content.raw:
As far as I understand his post, @faller is not requesting moving average - that's just an alternative solution to the current throttling approach. The desired solution would be to create and publish at the requested framerate - i.e. publish at the same framerate that Gazebo is generating the data. 
This is intended to be accomplished per drcsim pull-request 125 but for some reason the changes in this pull-request remove both Gazebo and ROS throttling instead of just ROS (why are there 2 independent throttling rates anyway?).
